text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse offers a very broad portfolio of surge protection devices and has also branched into passives, discretes, sensors, switches and semiconductors across thousands of SKUs
text_1_evidence: The core activity of Littelfuse is still ... surge protection: fuses, circuit breakers, etc.
the company has ... also branch out ... passives, discretes, sensors, switches and semiconductors
Littelfuse has thousands and thousands of SKUs
text_2_claim_summary: The Company conducts business through three segments—Electronics, Transportation and Industrial—with a wide array of products including fuses, PTC resettable fuses, switches, interconnect solutions and semiconductors
text_2_evidence: The Company conducts its business through three reportable segments: Electronics, Transportation, and Industrial.

Electronics Segment: consists of one of the broadest product offerings in the industry, including fuses and fuse accessories, PTC resettable fuses, electromechanical switches ... semiconductor products
Transportation Segment: consists of a wide range of circuit protection, power control and sensing technologies

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse serves diverse global end markets in electronics, transportation and industrial sectors; no single customer or market represents an outsized portion of revenue
text_1_evidence: just like analog industrial chip companies ... we are talking about an incomprehensibly wide range of products
no customer represents more than 10% of sales
diversified global end market exposure
text_2_claim_summary: Net sales are spread across multiple regions and segments, with no single customer accounting for more than 11% of net sales
text_2_evidence: For the fiscal year 2023, approximately 65% of the Company's net sales were to customers outside the United States
Sales to Arrow Electronics ... were 11.2%, 11.5% and 10.7% of consolidated net sales in 2023, 2022, and 2021, respectively. No other single customer accounted for more than 10%
Net sales by segment: Electronics $1.35bn, Transportation $678m, Industrial $334m

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse is well positioned to benefit from long-term secular growth themes in electrification and electronification across energy storage, renewables, EV charging, data centers and automation
text_1_evidence: it is a perfect play on increasing levels of electrification
end markets ... energy storage, renewable energy, data centres, factory automation, battery technology, EV charging infrastructure
text_2_claim_summary: The Company's strategy targets growth in sustainability, connectivity and safety themes, driven by electrification and power efficiency in its electronics, transportation and industrial end markets
text_2_evidence: we partner with customers to design and deliver innovative, reliable solutions ... empowering a sustainable, connected, and safer world
The Company is well-positioned within the center of the global structural growth themes of sustainability, connectivity, and safety
product demand is largely driven by electrification, energy and power efficiency, automation, connectivity, artificial intelligence, and safety

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a durable competitive moat based on its breadth of products, long history, cumulative expertise, strong brand in safety and criticality of its offerings
text_1_evidence: huge assortment of solutions ... difficult to replicate
has operated 97 years in this niche ... leads to cumulative learning that is very difficult to replicate
built its brand name for 97 years with customers relying on this company for safety
text_2_claim_summary: The Company competes globally on the basis of innovative products, breadth of product line, reliability, consistency, safety, technical capabilities, global footprint and customer service
text_2_evidence: The Company believes that it globally competes on the basis of innovative products, the breadth of its product line, the quality, design and performance of its products based on their reliability, consistency and safety
With its expanding, diversified product portfolio, the Company has evolved its presence across the industrial, transportation and electronics end markets it serves

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has executed a disciplined M&A strategy, completing numerous small acquisitions funded from internal cash flow without significant equity dilution
text_1_evidence: Since then, the company has completed 15 acquisitions
40% of FCF is returned to shareholders and 60% is used for M&A
This is financed by internal cash generation and debt levels have barely budged
text_2_claim_summary: In recent years, the Company has acquired Western Automation, C&K Switches, Embed, Carling Technologies and Hartland Controls, financing these transactions primarily with cash on hand and debt
text_2_evidence: On February 3, 2023, the Company completed the acquisition of Western Automation ... financed the transaction with cash on hand
On July 19, 2022, the Company acquired C&K Switches ... The net cash payment ... was funded through a combination of cash on hand and debt
On November 30, 2021, the Company acquired Carling ... The acquisition was funded with cash on hand

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has historically generated organic growth around 4-5% per year over the last decade
text_1_evidence: I landed at 4% organic growth historically
This compares to average reported organic growth of 5% over the last 7 years
text_2_claim_summary: In 2023, the Company experienced negative organic growth and has not reaffirmed a long-term organic growth rate near 4–5%
text_2_evidence: Net sales were $2,362.7 million, which decreased by 6.0% in 2023
The discrepancy between net sales in 2023 and 2022 included a 10% unfavorable organic component

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse consistently converts more than 100% of non-GAAP net income into free cash flow with modest capex (4-5% of sales)
text_1_evidence: Taking a look at margins, ... quality of earnings is high
Littelfuse generates very nice free cash flow. 40% of this FCF is returned to shareholders and 60% is used for M&A
text_2_claim_summary: Free cash flow consistently converts at or above 100% of net income, and capex remains low relative to sales
text_2_evidence: Littelfuse constantly converts more than 100% of non-GAAP net income into free cash flow
Littelfuse is not a capital intensive business, requiring only 4-5% of sales in capex

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse maintains low leverage with net debt/EBITDA around 1.3x and strong liquidity
text_1_evidence: net debt/EBITDA for 2023 is only 0.6x if all cash on the balance sheet is included
Management targets net debt/EBITDA between 1.5x–2.5x so we are comfortable today
text_2_claim_summary: As of 2023, the Company’s net debt to EBITDA ratio is approximately 1.3x, within its target range
text_2_evidence: Net debt/EBITDA for 2023 was 1.3x
Management targets a net debt/EBITDA ratio between 1.5x-2.5x
